: The diagram describes the various stages of honey production. Overall, what stands out is that the process consists of six stages, beginning with the collection of nectar from flowers by bees, and ending with the selling honey jars in the shops. Firstly, from flowers, the nectar is gathered by bees. In the next stage, honey is made by bees that turn nectar into honey in the beehives. After that, from beehives, honey is collected by bee-keepers. Subsequently, the honey is put in glass jars, so then they are ready for delivering. Finally, the jars of honey are displayed on the shelves of the shops

However, there are other acid particles that will probably mix with cloud water.
